business_rules.name: Transaction List Pagination
business_rules.description: Display transactions in pages of 10 records each
business_rules.logic: The system displays up to 10 transactions per page. Users can navigate forward and backward through pages using designated navigation controls.
actions: Display transaction ID, date, description, and amount for each record
Track first and last transaction IDs on current page
Set flag indicating if more pages exist

business_rules.name: Transaction Selection
business_rules.description: Allow users to select a specific transaction for detailed viewing
business_rules.logic: Users can enter 'S' next to a transaction to view its details. The system validates the selection and navigates to the transaction detail screen.
conditions: User enters selection indicator next to a transaction
actions: Transfer control to transaction detail program (COTRN01C)

business_rules.name: Transaction ID Search
business_rules.description: Allow users to search for transactions starting from a specific transaction ID
business_rules.logic: Users can enter a numeric transaction ID to start browsing from that point in the transaction list.
conditions: User enters a transaction ID in the search field
actions: Start browsing from the specified transaction ID
Display first page of results starting from that transaction

business_rules.name: Forward Page Navigation
business_rules.description: Navigate to the next page of transactions
business_rules.logic: When user requests next page, system retrieves the next set of up to 10 transactions starting after the last transaction on current page.
conditions: More transactions exist after current page
actions: Start browsing from last transaction ID on current page
Update first and last transaction IDs for new page

business_rules.name: Backward Page Navigation
business_rules.description: Navigate to the previous page of transactions
business_rules.logic: When user requests previous page, system retrieves the previous set of up to 10 transactions ending before the first transaction on current page.
conditions: Current page number is greater than 1
actions: Start browsing from first transaction ID on current page
Read previous transaction records in reverse order
Update first and last transaction IDs for new page

business_rules.name: Transaction Date Formatting
business_rules.logic: Convert transaction original timestamp from YYYY-MM-DD-HH.MM.SS.MMMMMM format to MM/DD/YY format for display.
actions: Extract year (last 2 digits), month, and day from timestamp
Display formatted date in transaction list

business_rules.name: Transaction Amount Formatting
business_rules.logic: Display transaction amount with sign indicator and 2 decimal places in format +99999999.99.

business_rules.name: End of List Detection
business_rules.description: Detect and handle when user reaches the end of transaction list
business_rules.logic: When attempting to navigate forward and no more transactions exist, inform user they are at the bottom of the list.
conditions: No more transactions exist after current page
actions: Display message 'You are already at the bottom of the page...'

business_rules.name: Beginning of List Detection
business_rules.description: Detect and handle when user reaches the beginning of transaction list
business_rules.logic: When attempting to navigate backward and already on first page, inform user they are at the top of the list.
conditions: Current page number is 1 or less
actions: Display message 'You are already at the top of the page...'

business_rules.name: Transaction File Browsing Initialization
business_rules.description: Initialize file browsing session for transaction retrieval
business_rules.logic: Start a browse session on the transaction file using the specified transaction ID as the starting key.
conditions: User requests transaction list or navigation
actions: Start browse on TRANSACT file with transaction ID as key

business_rules.name: Transaction File Browsing Termination
business_rules.logic: End the browse session on the transaction file after completing record retrieval operations.

business_rules.name: Page State Maintenance
business_rules.description: Maintain pagination state across user interactions
business_rules.logic: Track current page number, first and last transaction IDs on page, and whether more pages exist to enable proper navigation.
actions: Store first transaction ID on current page
Store last transaction ID on current page
Set flag indicating if next page exists

validations.error_message: Invalid selection. Valid value is S

calculations.name: Format Transaction Date
calculations.description: Convert transaction timestamp to display format
calculations.formula: Extract MM, DD, YY from YYYY-MM-DD-HH.MM.SS.MMMMMM and format as MM/DD/YY

calculations.name: Format Transaction Amount
calculations.description: Format transaction amount for display with sign and decimals
calculations.formula: Format as +99999999.99 with sign indicator and 2 decimal places

workflows.name: Display Transaction List
workflows.description: Initial display of transaction list when user accesses the screen

steps.action: Initialize page state with page number 0
Start browse on TRANSACT file from beginning or specified transaction ID
conditions: Transaction ID provided or start from beginning

steps.action: Retrieve up to 10 transaction records
Format transaction data for display (date and amount)
Populate screen fields with transaction data
Update page state (first ID, last ID, page number, next page flag)
End browse session
Display transaction list screen to user

workflows.name: Navigate Forward
workflows.description: Process user request to view next page of transactions

steps.action: Check if next page exists
If no next page, display message and maintain current page
Start browse from last transaction ID on current page
Read next transaction record
Retrieve up to 10 subsequent transactions
Format and populate screen with new transaction data
Increment page number and update page state
Check for additional pages
End browse session and display updated screen

workflows.name: Navigate Backward
workflows.description: Process user request to view previous page of transactions

steps.action: Check if current page is first page
If on first page, display message and maintain current page
Start browse from first transaction ID on current page
Read previous transaction records in reverse order
Retrieve up to 10 preceding transactions
Format and populate screen with transaction data
Decrement page number and update page state
End browse session and display updated screen

workflows.name: Select Transaction for Details
workflows.description: Process user selection of a specific transaction to view details

steps.action: Check each selection field for user input
Validate selection indicator is 'S' or 's'
If invalid selection, display error message
Store selected transaction ID
Set navigation context for transaction detail program
Transfer control to transaction detail program (COTRN01C)

workflows.name: Search by Transaction ID
workflows.description: Process user request to search for transactions starting from a specific ID

steps.action: Validate transaction ID is numeric
If not numeric, display error message
Reset page number to 0
Start browse from specified transaction ID
Retrieve and display first page of results
